alert.note: Alert for Sabine; San Augustine (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 8:08AM CDT until March 25 at 8:42AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following bayou in Texas... Ayish Bayou Near San Augustine affecting Sabine and San Augustine Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following bayou in Texas... Attoyac Bayou Near Chireno affecting Nacogdoches, Shelby, San Augustine and Rusk Counties. For the Attoyac Bayou...including Chireno...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Ayish Bayou...including San Augustine...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ayish Bayou Near San Augustine, Texas. * WHEN...From this Tuesday evening to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Minor lowland flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...The Ayish Bayou is expected to rise above flood stage late this Tuesday evening to a crest of 13.5 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 945 AM CDT.
